meanings.definition: Make a quick, nervous movement of the face or body as an instinctive reaction to surprise, fear, or pain.
meanings.sent1: She flinched when the balloon popped suddenly.
meanings.sent2: The cat flinched at the sound of thunder.
meanings.sent3: The baby flinched comically when the toy made a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: His heart flinched with fear as he heard the eerie creaking in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's body flinched involuntarily at the unexpected gunshot.

meanings.sent1: The horse flinched as a fly buzzed near its ear.
meanings.sent2: He flinched slightly when the teacher called his name unexpectedly.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel flinched playfully as it dodged the falling acorn.
meanings.sent4: The leaves on the tree flinched in the wind's strong gusts.
meanings.sent5: The child flinched with excitement when the magician pulled a rabbit out of the hat.
